objects.name: MessageText
objects.string:
FROM: clancyfemur@endsmeetstudios.org
TO: newhire@endsmeetstudios.org

SUBJECT: Welcome!

Hey rookie! Welcome to Endsmeet Studios. We’re so pleased to have you here.

We feel that your experience can help us develop our debut game, The Reapening. We’ve been working on it for quite some time, but we need more hands to get the game fully ready for the limelight. I look forward to collaborating with you on this project!

Sincerely,
Clancy Femur
Endsmeet Studios CEO

objects.name: HowToMakeAGameText
objects.string: How To Make A Game

objects.name: InstructionsText
objects.string:
Make games by putting together puzzles. 

A game can be submitted when all puzzle pieces are on the board. The pieces DO NOT need to be in the correct place in order to submit, however the more correct pieces there are the better the game will result.

Crunching will automatically move a piece to its correct place but it make you lose Employee Morale.

You regenerate some Employee morale back after each release, however you lose if it reaches 0.

objects.name: PublisherMessage
objects.string:
Welcome to the meat grinder, <INSERT NAME HERE> Productions/Studios/Inc/Whatever!
We here at Lucigames are surprised that you signed the contract, but hey, you needed the money, right? (Especially in this economy.)  

Anyway, get cracking on that game you pitched, PRONTO! Whatever lollygagging you used to do during your “creative process” is now gone. TIME IS MONEY! We expect nothing less than a constant flow of CHEDDAR CHEESE. Otherwise, we’ll have to shut your studio down. So get to breeding those cash cows and if it’s successful, then we’ll consider letting you have a sip of the milk. 

See you in the office!
Richard “Dick” Fuego
Lucigames CEO

objects.name: MessageText2
objects.string:
FROM: clancyfemur@endsmeetstudios.org
TO: all@endsmeetstudios.org

SUBJECT: OMG, WE DID IT!!!!!

Holy shit guys, the game is catching fire! I knew that the game was good, but I didn’t expect it to go viral! Congrats to you all! You all did such great jobs! We ain’t done yet, though. We planned for The Reapening to be a trilogy, so we might as well get started on the sequel. However, we’re going to need some extra money to get The Reapening 2 to its full potential. Luckily, a publishing team reached out and is willing to fund us.

Let’s catch lightning again, folks!
Clancy Femur
Endsmeet Studios CEO

objects.name: NewAdditionsText
objects.string: New Additions

objects.name: AdditionsText
objects.string:
Lucigames will be imposing a time limit upon your work. Don't sweat it for now but watch out because it gets smaller with each release!

Lucigames will also be letting you know their satisfaction with you with this red bar. Don't go too far over their time limits to keep them happy. Do not let this reach 0.

This blue bar shows your customers' satisfaction with your games. Try to keep this up by releasing puzzles as complete as you can make them.

objects.name: GoodbyeText
objects.string: The pressure is on! With Endsmeet Studios being funded by Lucigames, you will have to step up your development skills.  You must keep company morale high and satisfy the publisher’s demands to survive this game. It’s going to be tough out there, so good luck!

if its in a slot pop it out

objects.name: debug
objects.string: debug

objects.name: Message1Text
objects.string:
FROM: clancyfemur@endsmeetstudios.org
TO: all@endsmeetstudios.org

SUBJECT: Future Plans

It feels like such a long time ago when we decided to open up Endsmeet Studios. We were a simple company just looking to make some badass games, but now look at us! The Reapening has treated us quite well, and the experience we’ve all gained from developing it has proven essential to our growth as a team. However, I definitely agree with you guys that it’s high time we moved on to a new series.

Recently, I and a couple of other team members have put together a pitch for the new IP we conceptualized during last month’s meeting. The Reapening Trilogy was extremely successful, so I think they’d be willing to give us a shot. We sure as hell proved our worth the last three times. Expect an email from the higher-ups about their decision soon. In the meantime, enjoy your paychecks. You’ve all earned them!

Peace!
Clancy Femur
Endsmeet Studios CEO

objects.name: Message2Text
objects.string:
FROM: dickfuego@lucigames.org
TO: all@endsmeetstudios.org

SUBJECT: Congratulations!

We here at Lucigames would like to congratulate you all on finishing the third Reapening game (frankly, we didn’t think you guys would last). The franchise has proven to be quite lucrative! Ahhh, the power of brand recognition... Speaking of which, let's talk about the pitch for the new IP you guys proposed….

THE NEW IP IS NOT GOING TO BE GREENLIT.

To simply put it, we cannot give you the go-ahead on making a new series. It’s too much of a financial risk, and if our fiscal reports tell us anything, it’s that the people FREAKING LOVE The Reapening. You’ve already made the formula for the cash cows, so why not just replicate it? Hell, you could even modify the formula so that it attracts more people. Actually, could is the wrong word; you NEED to modify the formula so that it can attract as many people as possible. We’ll be sending in a new producer to help give suggestions on how to make your game more popular. 

GIVE THE PEOPLE WHAT THEY WANT.
Richard “Dick” Fuego
Lucigames CEO

objects.name: Message3Text
objects.string:
The traditional release parties at the local bar haven’t been the same since The Reapening 4 and its DLC came out. You and your work buddy share a bottle of Jack and talk about the ridiculous demands that the new producer makes. Everyone hates him, but not much can be done due to the fact that disagreeing could mean losing your job. 

You get a notification on your phone; the reviews just came in for the Bone Grindr DLC.

An excerpt from a game journalist reviewing the Bone Grindr DLC for The Reapening 4:

“If you were not a fan of The Reapening 4, this DLC will not win you over. Doubling down on the romantic comedy style of the base game, something that is extremely out of place in a franchise that is best known for its post-apocalyptic dark fantasy atmosphere, the player is tasked with trying to get the franchise hero Stern Marrow to score with Ulna Ribs. I kid you not, this game is asking you to make two skeletons bone. Who the hell is this game made for?”

That right there is the question of the century.

objects.name: Message4Text
objects.string:
After a few years of working at Endsmeet Studios, you decide that enough is enough and begin to look for jobs. While your time proved gruelling near the end, you felt that you learned a lot about the experience. 

You learned about being more careful when it comes to trusting publishers. 

You learned about how the greed of others can affect your livelihood and your passions.

And you learned how you can network with your peers.

Although Endsmeet is a shell of itself now, with most of the veteran staff moving to greener pastures as soon as their contracts were finished, you became great friends with them, and together you opened a new studio. You asked Clancy, the CEO of Endsmeet, to come with you, but he declined due to wanting to stay with his company. It must be due to the sunk cost fallacy. 
Nevertheless, you and your colleagues are ready to start fresh, and with the knowledge you’ve gained, you make a promise to never again work yourself to the bone.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
This can be used to:
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
